body:
there is no need for R op. We just need to differentiate d(v^Tg)/dx where g = dL/dx

The problem here is most ops don't support second order derivative. For start you can try adding FGradient to Fully connected layer.
try kvstore = 'device'/'local'/'device_allreduce' etc and use the fastest one
@mli We should change the defaults
@sergeykolychev fixed. thanks for the eyes.
Same here. But in my case, one and only one *_output was printed out of 60+ layers, pretty weird.
pull the latest code plz. f0a450d is updated 8 days ago, while the pr is merged 3 days ago.
Then we need a list of all places. Or better, a script for doing this.
@eric-haibin-lin Could you have a look?
@madjam @zackchase @piiswrong - Can you please review this change?

I'd vote for separate versioning scheme, though I try to keep the same major version. For example
currently perl api has version 0.95. But it would be nice to have flexibility release to cpan 0.9501, 02, etc. with incremental updates and bugfixes.
more details -> Other OS & build from source
@piiswrong - Makes sense. Changed from more details.. to "Other OS and building from source.."

Perhaps it's premature for a pull request on this since the Why MXNet doc
is not part of the main repo yet (still on the doc staging repo
https://github.com/zackchase/mxnet-docs)

mac osx -> macOS

ubuntu, macos, and docker are quite different options, it doesn't make sense to me to put them side by side. also the first two options only install the python package. i don't think we are ready to to put them in the front page if pre-build for other languages are not ready now

So it may be better to do some minor modifications to the existing CodeBlock class?

I'm prefer that way so we can keep codes short

You need to adjust the 'workload' list accordingly when performing data parallel on heterogeneous machines 

On 2017年4月4日, at 20:36, bachml <notifications@github.com> wrote:

Further to say, does it make sense using distributed training with different performance machines, like 4Titan machine with 3Titan machine?

@harusametime I think the problem happen in  0.9 version's "mnist_pt.arg" file, that  I used it to run 0.7 version's code.
Now, I use the 0.7 version's "mnist_pt.arg", the code can work

Thanks @WellyZhang !
I Use the method ，enter the conda mxnet enviorment first then 
` make clean;make -j$(nproc) ` 
and
 `cd python`.
Type the commd 
`python setup.py install `.
At last the problem sloved.
Thanks
can it support the sparse format such as libsvm

I confirm it now works as expected.
Thank you @Ldpe2G !
where can i find the kvstore's value options? I can't find any of them , such as 'device', 'device_allreduce',  in the mxnet/python/mxnet/ folder.
@javelinjs I tried with the latest version now that the compilation issue has been solved and got the same result.

I found that the GPU memory usage increase in the line: 
exector = fcnxs.bind(ctx, fcnxs_args ,args_grad=None, grad_req="null", aux_states=fcnxs_args)
but it seems that the GPU memory is not released, is there any way to address the problem? Also, I wonder where the feature maps  stored.

Are you doing data parallel? Did you scale up the batch size linearly with the number of GPUs?

Error Message:

When I use one 1080 gpu to train, the speed is 9 sanples/s,when I use two 1080, the speed has improved a little,but three 1080 has the same speed with two 1080, when I use four 1080 , the speed even decrease. I want to know how to solve it ,thank you!

On 2017年4月5日, at 01:14, Shuai Yuan <notifications@github.com> wrote:

mark

—
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
the api is volatile so we don't really want to add this every where yet.

Regarding bind(), the memory is expected to increase, as MXNet is building computation graph based on symbols and allocating resources for it. 

On 2017年4月6日, at 08:24, KeLipeng <notifications@github.com> wrote:

I found that the GPU memory usage increase in the line:
exector = fcnxs.bind(ctx, fcnxs_args ,args_grad=None, grad_req="null", aux_states=fcnxs_args)
but it seems that the GPU memory is not released, is there any way to address the problem? Also, I wonder where the feature maps stored.

—
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
it should be MXNET_USE_CUDA

Yes this is a typo. The paragraph needs some light revisions and we also need to be serious about better styling before merging On Apr 6, 2017 10:40 AM, "Madan Jampani" wrote: > *@madjam* commented on this pull request. > ------------------------------ > > In docs/_static/mxnet-theme/index.html > : > > > @@ -21,6 +24,54 @@ > > > > + > +
> +
> +
> +
> +

What is MXNet?

> +

> + Deep learning denotes the modern incarnation of neural networks, and it's the technology behind recent breakthroughs in self-driving cars, machine translation, speech recognition and more. While widespread interest in deep learning took off in 2012, deep learning has already become an indispensable tool for countless industries. Bucket key is used to switch bucketing module. In bucketing module, you can specify bucket key for each data batch to use different module for training/testing/predicting.

```
  def forward(self, data_batch, is_train=None):
        """Forward computation.

        Parameters
        ----------
        data_batch : DataBatch
        is_train : bool
            Default is `None`, in which case `is_train` is take as `self.for_training`.
        """
        assert self.binded and self.params_initialized
        self.switch_bucket(data_batch.bucket_key, data_batch.provide_data,
                           data_batch.provide_label)
        self._curr_module.forward(data_batch, is_train=is_train)
```

This is the forward of bucketing_module. Bucket key of each data batch is used to switch module before forward operation.

do we really need to change binded to bound? It can potentially cause a lot of troubles.

Binded appears to not be a real word. The correct past tense is  "bound".
See for reference in computer science any of Linux reference material on
sockets. I suggest we use reasonable, intelligible terms wherever possible
and better to make the change now than further down the road. Why should
things break as long as we keep

@property binded

for backward compatibility?

The difficulty is creating a view of the **take** result from an ndarray in which case the memory is not contiguous. I don't think mxnet currently supports that since most of the operators relies on contiguous memory allocation for tensors. Have you timed your first solution in your application? Is it really a bottleneck?

Just updated the file. This will be used to test the build process of mxnet.js from the latest emscripten version (built from source) to ensure stability. Emscripten has to be built on ubuntu (and windows) and not apt installed since the apt version on ubuntu is old and fails when building MXNet.js, however on Mac the brew version is sufficiently recent such that this isn't a problem. If we want to standardize on a particular versions of emscripten we can checkout specific hashes in the repo before build.
